summary: MaiaSpace CBO Michael Callari and Business Development Senior Manager Angela Diaz Labrador to attend SmallSat Europe in Amsterdam (May 27-28, 2025), with Callari speaking on a panel about launch capabilities on May 27[cite: 1].
MaiaSpace team members ("MaiaSpacers") will participate in the T24 BREIZH 2025 triathlon on June 28-29, 2025, to promote team spirit and endurance[cite: 3, 5].
MaiaSpace announces the success of its first full-scale stages separation test campaign using their custom-built "TireBouchon" test bench in Vernon[cite: 7, 10].

MaiaSpace Head of Public Relations, Raphael Chevrier, discussed company milestones, European industrial partnerships (over 50% non-French), and the 2026 target for Maia's first flight during a panel at DLR Industrial Days in Lampoldshausen[cite: 12, 13, 14].

MaiaSpace celebrates its 3rd anniversary, highlighting growth to over 270 employees[cite: 16], prototype development[cite: 17], various tests (Colibri kick-stage hot firing, stages separation)[cite: 18], launch pad securization at Guiana Space Center[cite: 18], a first commercial contract[cite: 18], and targeting first Prometheus engine firing on Upper Stage this year, with first test flight and commercial operations in 2026[cite: 20].

MaiaSpace signs a contract with CRYO DIFFUSION - QTC group and SpaceDreamS for the supply of Methane filling equipment at the Guiana Space Center launch zone[cite: 22], with on-site work for operational implementation planned for 2026[cite: 23].

MaiaSpace's Raphaël Breda, Operational Ground Systems Product Owner & Launch Operations System Architect, discussed the sea barge for first stage recovery (operations set to start in 2027) at the Maritime Innovation Day[cite: 26, 27].
MaiaSpace hosted Arnaud Prost, member of the ESA astronaut reserve, for an exchange about his experiences and potential surveillance of Kourou for Maia launches. (Post in French) [cite: 28, 29, 30]
MaiaSpace signs its first commercial contract with Exotrail, a France-based space logistics leader, to launch multiple spacevan™ servicer missions starting as early as 2027[cite: 32, 33, 35].

Repost of a Laurent TRAN DIEN post highlighting MaiaSpace's Exotrail contract and CEO Yohann Leroy's TV appearance on French news, emphasizing their mission to use satellites for Earth's benefit[cite: 42, 44].

MaiaSpace hosted German officials (Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy, German Aerospace Center DLR) at its Vernon proto-factory[cite: 46, 48], showcasing its iterative development approach, European partnerships (over 50% non-French)[cite: 51], ~250 employee count[cite: 52], and the 2026 first flight target[cite: 49].

At the European Space Conference in Brussels, MaiaSpace CEO Yohann Leroy emphasized the need for a 3x cost reduction for mini-launchers[cite: 54], speed (first flight 2026)[cite: 55], scalability (reusable/expendable versions, Colibri kick-stage)[cite: 56], evolutivity[cite: 56], and sustainability (LOx/Bio-sourced Methane)[cite: 57].

Repost: MaiaSpace and Space Faculty announce a strategic collaboration to strengthen cross-continent partnerships, advance the global space ecosystem, expand Asia Pacific presence, and focus on talent development in Singapore and the region[cite: 60, 61, 62].

MaiaSpace hosted the Agence de l'innovation de défense (AID) director, Patrick Aufort, at its Vernon facilities[cite: 64, 65], showcasing operational milestones for its reusable mini-launcher including the upper stage prototype with Prometheus® mock-up[cite: 66], inter-stage system test bench[cite: 67], and Colibri kick-stage[cite: 68].

MaiaSpace CEO Yohann Leroy published an op-ed in Les Echos urging Europe to shift from public subsidies for technological development to models supporting operational and commercial development through launch service contracts for new launch vehicles, leveraging the European Launcher Challenge[cite: 71, 76, 78, 79].
MaiaSpace team extends New Year 2025 wishes and looks forward to #2025Challenges.
MaiaSpace announces its team has grown to 220 members [cite: 91] and has wrapped up its latest 3-month Program Increment (PI) using the Agile method, highlighting company evolution[cite: 92, 93].

MaiaSpace has been selected by CNES to operate its reusable launcher from the former Soyuz launch pad (ELS) at the Guiana Space Center[cite: 96, 103], targeting commercial exploitation in 2026 [cite: 98, 104] with a lift-off capacity of 1500 kg (expendable) or 500 kg (reusable) to SSO[cite: 110].

MaiaSpace recaps its #WSBW2024 participation: 20+ customer meetings[cite: 115], a company cocktail[cite: 116], and CEO Yohann Leroy's panel discussing European project competition, cooperation, and environmental footprint as a future competitive advantage for their reusable launcher (up to 4 tons LEO capacity)[cite: 115, 118, 122].

MaiaSpace CEO Yohann Leroy to be featured on NASASpaceflight LLC YouTube channel on Wednesday, March 19th at 8pm Paris Time (19:00 UTC) to discuss the development of Europe's first reusable mini-launcher[cite: 124].

MaiaSpace received a mock-up of the LOX/bio-methane Prometheus® engine for its #Maia launcher's upper stage prototype in Vernon[cite: 128], validated connections and integration[cite: 129], and is preparing for wet rehearsals with liquid nitrogen, with hot firing tests to follow in 2025[cite: 130], targeting commercial exploitation in 2026[cite: 131].

ESA Director General Josef Aschbacher, Thilo Kranz, and Apostolia Karamali visited MaiaSpace's factory in Vernon in July[cite: 132], reviewing their reusable mini-launcher development, iterative approach[cite: 133], Prometheus engine use[cite: 134], and European industrial footprint (40% non-French recurring costs)[cite: 135].
MaiaSpace hosted NASA (Matthew Koeppe) and JAXA (Chiharu Hoshino, Morimoto Kouichi) Paris Representatives at the MaiaSpace Proto-Factory in Vernon for discussions[cite: 141, 142, 143].

Repost: MaiaSpace's Antoinette Ott and Jérémie Hassin presented paper #D2.1.5 at IAC2024 in Milan on balancing competitiveness and sustainability, citing choices for reusability, Methane/BioMethane fuel, and kickstage[cite: 145, 146, 147, 150].

Repost: Arkadia Space announces its first commercial contract with MaiaSpace to supply 250N monopropellant thrusters for the Reaction Control System (RCS) of MaiaSpace’s reusable mini-launcher[cite: 152, 155], using green hydrogen peroxide-based propellant [cite: 170] and developed under ESA's ARIEL contract[cite: 157, 158].

MaiaSpace's upper stage prototype underwent new cryogenic fillings with liquid methane[cite: 181], highlighting methane's benefits for performance/robustness balance[cite: 182], simpler/compact tanks[cite: 183], and lower environmental impact (bio-methane from local waste/crops, reduced black carbon emissions under PhD study co-funded by MaiaSpace)[cite: 184, 185, 187].
MaiaSpace concludes three days of discussions with partners, customers, and students about its #Maia reusable launcher (with vertical main stage landing at sea) at ILA Berlin[cite: 188, 189].

MaiaSpace CEO Yohann Leroy will provide a summary and conclusions for two space roundtables (Medical Research in Space, Space Nuclear Propulsion) and discuss future challenges at Bpifrance's #B1G2024 event on October 10th at Accor Arena[cite: 191, 197].
Repost of a Süddeutsche Zeitung article (in German) about Ariane Group's subsidiary MaiaSpace developing the competitive "Maia" small rocket[cite: 198, 199].
MaiaSpace business team will attend the 2025 #SATShow in Washington, D.C., from March 10 to 13, for discussions and updates on their #Maia launcher[cite: 202, 203].
Repost: MaiaSpace VP Space Mobility, Jeremie Hassin, shared the company's story (now 190 employees) and its journey at the Summer Space Festival in Lille[cite: 204].

MaiaSpace's Raphael Chevrier, PhD, will speak about their two-stage reusable mini-launcher at the 'Journée de l'innovation' hosted by CNES in Toulouse on Tuesday, February 4th at 11 AM[cite: 205, 209]; Simon Tollis will also attend[cite: 206].

MaiaSpace's Laurent TRAN DIEN (Business Development Senior Manager) and Beatriz Romero (Head of Customer Experience & Success Office) will attend the SmallSat Symposium in Mountain View, California, to discuss developments and opportunities for their reusable mini-launcher[cite: 211, 212].

MaiaSpace recaps its participation at ILA Berlin, noting three days of intense and exciting discussions about the #Maia launcher[cite: 214]. (This is a repost or very similar to another ILA Berlin post by MaiaSpace).

MaiaSpace team will attend the 17th European Space Conference in Brussels on January 28-29[cite: 221], with CEO Yohann Leroy participating in a roundtable on "Infrastructure, operations and launchers for agile, sustainable and competitive launch services" on Jan. 29 @12:10 pm[cite: 223].
MaiaSpace posts a quiz asking about a specific test bench: its use, team-given name, and location[cite: 218, 219, 224].

MaiaSpace CEO Yohann Leroy is featured in Corriere della Sera, explaining the company's plan to develop Europe's first partially reusable mini-launcher involving vertical recovery of the Main Stage on a barge at sea[cite: 225].

MaiaSpace will attend Space Tech Expo Europe in Bremen (November 19-21), with System Architect Laura Appolloni presenting during the technical session on propulsion on November 21 @ 10:50 am[cite: 226].
MaiaSpace announces its 2025 internship campaign, inviting applications to work on cutting-edge space technology projects and gain hands-on experience[cite: 228, 229, 231, 232].

MaiaSpace CBO Michael Callari participated in a panel at the APSCC Satellite Conference in Bangkok, discussing new paths in launch business models focusing on reusability, customer-centricity, and eco-responsibility[cite: 234, 235].

MaiaSpace environmental performance expert Antoinette Ott explained their Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) approach for launchers since day one at the 1st International Symposium on Small Launch Vehicles and Spaceports, emphasizing mitigation of environmental impact[cite: 239, 240].

MaiaSpace hosted JAXA Paris Director #Morimoto Kouichi and Deputy Director Chiharu Hoshino at their La Défense offices to discuss shared goals for advancing the space industry, focusing on eco-responsible and reusable launch vehicles and future international collaboration[cite: 241, 242, 243].

MaiaSpace team, including CBO Michael Callari (panelist on 'Launch Business Model - Business as Usual or New Path Forward' on Nov. 6th at 10:30) and Business Development Senior Manager Laurent Tran Dien, to attend the APSCC conference in Bangkok[cite: 246].

MaiaSpace to attend the 75th International Astronautical Congress (IAC 2024) in Milan (October 14-18), with Jeremie Hassin (space mobility expert) and Antoinette Ott (environmental performance engineer) presenting "MaiaSpace Solutions for Space Mobility" on October 14th at 16:45[cite: 247, 248].

MaiaSpace VP in Space Mobility, Jérémie Hassin, will participate in the panel 'Souveraineté d'Accès à l'Espace' at the Stars'Up festival in Meudon on Thursday, September 26, 2024, at 11:00 am at Hangar Y[cite: 249, 250].

MaiaSpace team will participate in #WSBW in Paris (Sept. 16-20, 2024)[cite: 252], with CEO Yohann Leroy speaking on the panel "Thrust and Trust: Enabling Space Transportation" on Wednesday, Sept. 18th at 17:25 about their reusable launcher with sea recovery[cite: 254].

MaiaSpace Senior System Engineer, Christophe Bonnal, will attend the #SpaceForum by La Tribune in #Toulouse on Tuesday, September 10th, participating in the roundtable "Is a sustainable Space environment possible?" at 10:40 am[cite: 256].

MaiaSpace's Louis Janot (Market Access Intelligence expert) and Laurent TRAN DIEN (Senior Manager of Business Development) will attend the Small Satellite Conference (SmallSat) in #Logan, Utah, from August 3-8 to discuss #Maia latest developments and launch services[cite: 260, 261, 262].
MaiaSpace congratulates ESA, ArianeGroup, CNES, ARIANESPACE, and all Ariane industrial partners on the successful inaugural launch of #Ariane6 on July 9, 2024[cite: 264, 265].
MaiaSpace CPO Jerome VILA will participate in the roundtable "New Space and Decarbonation" at 'Les Assises du NewSpace - Saison 3' on Tuesday, June 25, 2024, at 16:45 at CNIT Forest[cite: 269].

MaiaSpace CEO discussed the mini-launcher market at the Paris Air Forum, highlighting the economic benefits of reusability for privately funded mini-launchers (wider market access, higher cadence, cost reduction) and the company's agile, risk-taking culture combined with European space expertise[cite: 270, 271, 272, 273].
MaiaSpace CEO, Yohann Leroy, will participate in the panel "Quel marché pour les mini-lanceurs ?" at the Paris Air Forum on the day of the post at 15:35 pm at Maison de la Mutualité[cite: 274].

MaiaSpace will be at ILA Berlin - Pioneering Aerospace from June 5 to 7 in Hall 4, ExpoCenter Airport[cite: 275, 276]. CEO Yohann Leroy will give a presentation at ILA STAGE Space, Hall 4 on June 5 @ 17:00[cite: 277].
